metadata.title: CVE-2017-14926 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In Poppler 0.59.0, a NULL Pointer Dereference exists inAnnotRichMedia::Content::Content in Annot.cc via a crafted PDF document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14926` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4').
